title: Eliminate a Variable
text: Elimintate the y's by multiplying the second equation by $$5$$.\n$$6x-5y=-1$$\n$$5\left(2x+y\right)=5\times13$$

title: Add the Equations to Eliminate One Variable
text: Add the x's, y's, and constants. $$y$$ will be eliminated and then solve for $$x$$.\n$$16x=64$$\n$$x=4$$
speech: Add the x's, y's, and constants.  y  will be eliminated and then solve for  x .\n 16 x is equal to 64 \n x, is equal to 4

title: Substitute Solution into Original Equations
text:
Substitute $$x=4$$ into the first equation, $$6x-5y=-1$$. Then solve for $$y$$.
$$6x-5y=-1$$
$$6	imes4-5y=-1$$
$$24-5y=-1$$
$$-5y=-25$$
$$y=5$$

title: Solution as Ordered Pair
text: Solution to the system of equations is $$(4,5)$$.
